September 15* 1952
Mr. Graydon Ausmus
NAEB Vice-President
W U 0 A
University of Alabama
University, Alabama
Dear Graydons
This letter brings you the latest from this
point. Enclosed you®11 find biographical data on Bro, Morris,
Wynn, Robert L. Peterson, and living L# Merrill.
You911 find also comments of Professor Tom Benner
on one Albin C. Bro. Incidentally, Tom*s remarks on patience,
tact, charm, etc. were Instantly forthcoming, and preceded
other remarks which came out in our conversation,,
I have no reply to the Skornia cablegram, so
I have done nothing® I have no word on Wynn, so I have done
nothing. I shall be in Springfield Thursday, where I shall
have an opportunity, I hope, of picking up something
additional on Morris*
I'm glad you had a chance to shake hands with
Bob peters on. It was one of those chuckling coincidences
that" h© should pass by at the moment. X looked up biographical
data, ^ust in case they would be helpful to anyone.
This letter goes to you, with copies of it
and all enclosures to Paulu, Miller, Hull, and Miles. To
no one else, unless otherwise instructed.
Again, my apologies for the mix-up by Schooley
in his Saturday evening eating invitation. We°4 enjoyed having
you, and I trust you°d been happy to be present. I must
be getting old, to have forgotten our previous engagement.
Regards,
Prank Ea Schooley
NAEB Treasurer
